fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Referring to makes all the moving parts clear here. Since f commutes with the boundary maps, it maps the boundaries in C_n to the boundaries in D_n. Therefore the map is well-defined after passing to the quotient.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Chain maps induce maps on homology

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: A chain map f : C \to D induces a family of homomorphisms f_* : H_n (C) \to H_n (D) on the homology groups. The identity map induces the identity morphism, and a composition of maps f \circ g induces composition homomorphism (f \circ g)_* = f_* \circ g_*.

Referring to makes all the moving parts clear here. Since f commutes with the boundary maps, it maps the boundaries in C_n to the boundaries in D_n. Therefore the map is well-defined after passing to the quotient.

Appropriately combing two copies of , we get the following picture for a chain map. The upper and lower rows form chain complexes, while each four adjacent blocks form a pattern representing commutative squares.
